// src/pages/About.js import React from "react"; export default function About() { return (

About Me

I’m currently pursuing an MPhil in Biotechnology at the University of Cambridge, where my work focuses on the intersection of machine learning, biology, and public policy. Prior to this, I completed a Bachelor of Mathematics at the University of Edinburgh, where I specialized in probabilistic modeling and AI.

My research interests span algorithmic governance, AI safety, biological discovery, and the societal implications of emerging technologies. I believe we are entering a period of accelerating change — and that shaping it well requires deep technical insight aligned with strong values and institutional imagination.

Outside of academic work, I enjoy designing systems that make sense of complexity, building open-source tools, and exploring how technology can support long-term thinking in institutions.

Quick Facts

  • MPhil Biotechnology @ Cambridge
  • BMath @ Edinburgh — dissertation on convolutional Gaussian processes
  • Interested in AI for biology, UK policy, and longterm institutional design
  • Python + React dev • Loves information design • Plays football poorly but enthusiastically
); }
